siminov.hybrid.adapter.handlers
Class DatabaseHandler

java.lang.Object
  siminov.hybrid.adapter.handlers.DatabaseHandler

public class DatabaseHandler
extends java.lang.Object

It handles all request related to database. LIKE: save, update, saveOrUpdate, delete.

select

public java.lang.String select(java.lang.String className,
                               java.lang.Boolean distinct,
                               java.lang.String whereClause,
                               java.lang.String[] columnNames,
                               java.lang.String[] groupBy,
                               java.lang.String havingClause,
                               java.lang.String[] orderBy,
                               java.lang.String whichOrderBy,
                               java.lang.String limit)
                        throws DatabaseException
Handles Database Select Request From Web.

Parameters:
className - Web Model Function Name.
distinct - Distinct tuples need to be fetched or not.
whereClause - Where Clause based on which tuples will be fetched from table.
columnNames - Name of Columns for which data needs to be fetched.
groupBy - Used to specify GROUP BY statement in conjunction with the aggregate functions to group the result-set by one or more columns.
havingClause - Used to specify HAVING clause to SQL because the WHERE keyword could not be used with aggregate functions.
orderBy - Used to specify ORDER BY keyword to sort the result-set.
whichOrderBy - Used to specify ORDER BY ASC OR DESC keyword to sort the result-set in ascending order.
limit - Used to specify the range of data need to fetch from table.
Returns:
Return Tuples Fetched From Table.
Throws:
DatabaseException - If any exception occur while selecting data in Database.

Parameters:

distinct - Distinct tuples needs to be calculated or not.
whereClause - Where Clause based on which Count needs to be found.
groupBys - Used to specify GROUP BY statement in conjunction with the aggregate functions to group the result-set by one or more columns.
having - Used to specify HAVING clause to SQL because the WHERE keyword could not be used with aggregate functions.
Returns:
Count Of Tuples.
Throws:
DatabaseException - If any error occur while getting count.
